WorkItem.ClosedComment: Most likely related to a different issue with incremental optimizations which was fixed.
WorkItem.Description:
Hello.
I just made a little test with mage T9 gear...
And I was strongly estonished that the 4T9 set bonus seems to be not more interesting than 2T8 set bonus... in fire spec(20/51/0).
Dps calculate (assuming hit caped) with 2T9.25 & 2T8.25 = 7454
Dps calculate (assuming hit caped) with 2T9.25 & 2T9.10 = 7479
 
So, my question is : Is the 4T9 set bonus correctly implemented in the calculations?
Thank in advance for your interest in this issue...
 
ps: And once again, many thanks for this amazing usefull and well design software :)

Comments.Message: It is implemented into RAWR. You may have had some good pieces of gear that allowed for the small dps increase.

Mage's 4T9, Khadgar's Regalia 4 Piece, indeed should "Increases the critical strike chance of your Fireball, Frostbolt, Frostfire Bolt, Arcane Missiles, and Arcane Blast spells by 5%."

However, I doubt Rawr counts this. There is this Regalia tagged in my Buffs-pane when equipping any of those 4 pieces at once, but not markable differences on numbers.
Or could the 2T8 & 2T9 be so powerful combination that going 4T9 doesn't effect much or goes even worse?

Brilliant software though. Thumbs up!

There's a REALLY easy way to check and see if a buff or a talent, etc. is giving value for your character.

Use the Comparison charts for the corresponding thing, like for Regalia 4 Piece, go to the Buffs > All Buffs comparison chart and sort by alphabetical. From there you just need to find the K's in the list and see if it's NOT 0.0

Jothay, oh nice. Have missed that dropdown totally. Though if and when it shows, can it be trusted that it really yields 5% crit on those spells?

offtopic: For comparison I browsed my enchants and here is a screenshot where 50 spelldmg is better than 63 spelldmg?
runtu, simply look at that chart. If it has a DPS value for 4T9, then it's valuing 4T9.

If it has value (NOT 0.0 DPS in the Buffs Comparison), you can assume that it's giving 5% crit where applicable. If you want to start questioning that when it has it's value you start a snowball effect of questioning this that and the other. You have to take heart that Mr Mage dev knows what he's doing (and this dude is nuts :P)
